Menus Interface¶

class epyk.interfaces.components.CompMenus.Menus(context)¶
bottom(data=None, color=None, width=100, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, helper=None, options=None, profile=None)¶

Usage:

l = rptObj.ui.lists.list(["A", "B"])

button(value, object, symbol=None, width='auto', '', height=None, 'px', options=None, profile=False)¶

Usage:

mb = rptObj.ui.menus.button("Value", rptObj.ui.button("sub button"))
mb.item.click([rptObj.js.alert(mb.item.dom.content)])

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlContainer.Div

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlButton.Button

  • value –

  • object –

  • symbol –

  • width –

  • height –

  • options –

  • profile –

buttons(data=None, color=None, width=100, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, helper=None, options=None, profile=None)¶

Usage:

bs = rptObj.ui.buttons.buttons(["Button", "Button 2", "Button 3"])
bs[2].click([
rptObj.js.alert(bs[2].dom.content)
])

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlButton.Buttons

Parameters

  • data –

  • color –

  • width –

  • height –

  • htmlCode –

  • helper –

  • profile –

contextual(records=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', visible=False, options=None, profile=None)¶

Set a bespoke Context Menu on an Item. This will create a popup on the page with action. This component is generic is need to be added to a component to work

Usage:

menu = rptObj.ui.contextual([{"text": 'text', 'event': 'alert("ok")'}])
rptObj.ui.title("Test").attach_menu(menu)

Related Pages:

toolbar(data, width='auto', '', height=None, 'px', options=None, profile=False)¶

Usage:

tb = rptObj.ui.menus.toolbar(["fas fa-paint-brush", "fas fa-code"])
tb[1].link.val = 4589
tb[1].tooltip("This is a tooltip")
tb[0].style.css.color = 'red'

Underlying HTML Objects:

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlContainer.Div

  • epyk.core.html.HtmlImage.Badge
